data.title: C.J. Cherryh
data.text:
Name: Carolyn Janice Cherry Also Known As: C.J. Cherryh Occupation: Author Medium: Novels, short stories Works: Alliance-Union universe, Cyteen, Merovingen Nights shared universe, Foreigner series, others Official Website(s): https://cherryh.com/ Fan Website(s): On Fanlore: Related pages

C.J. Cherryh is an American science fiction author, and winner of multiple Hugo awards for her novels. Her most famous stories are set in the Alliance-Union universe, a spacefaring civilization set in the stars neighboring Earth. Most stories deal with the conflict between the highly independent trading Alliance dominated by mostly Matrilineal ship families and station dwellers, and the monolithic planet based Union with its cloned slaves.

Downbelow Station is set at Allianceâ€™s largest station which circles a planet with intelligent hominid like aliens. Cyteen tells the story of labor-stretched Union and the psychologists who create their cloned slave class.

Fandom

One area favored by fans is the deeply psychological world of the scientists on Cyteen, and the character Ari Emory II, the clone of the designer of the slave class (the Azi).

There is also numerous fan art for her Chanur series (a story where a human finds himself on the ship of Lion-like aliens called the Hani) as well as her Foreigner series.

Example Fanworks

Filk

Finity's End and Other Songs of the Station Trade, a 1985 filk album

Fever Season, a 1991 filk album

Fanzines

SHON'AI, a 1990s fanzine published by the Cherryh's Khemeis
